item.title: Is the Loudest Voice Right? – Part 2
item.description:
We are are a spiritual crossroad in the western world. Every day, more Christian leaders seem to be moving away from the time-tested, unchanging truths of the Bible. Does God change with the culture? Let’s talk about it! The question for Christians is simple: will we follow culture? Or will we follow Christ?

Join Heidi as she talks about some of the big questions we’re facing and why she believes that Christ > culture.

Why I’ll Take Courageous Jen Hatmaker Over her Cowardly Critics Everyday
Who’s In Charge of the Christian Blogosphere?

item.title: The Greatest of these is Love: A Conversation About Transgenderism and Our Role as Believers
item.description:
Today on the podcast, I’m replying to a question I am getting a lot lately: “How do we respond to the cultural push to normalize gender fluidity?”
This is an important topic, but we can’t talk about transgender issues—or any other issue—without first remembering that God calls us to speak the truth in love. God loves us, no matter our struggles. Surely His heart breaks over the sin that is causing people to do irreparable harm to their bodies in the name of finding their own version of truth.
We are a culture in crisis.

Somehow we’ve come to a place where women who do not want men in their bathrooms and locker rooms are accused of bigotry and labeled “transphobic.” It’s an upside-down world and it’s requiring that we have a tough conversation. Listen in as we talk about this very important topic.
5 Things to Avoid When Discussing the Bible’s Teaching on Gender
Diamond Dee Interview
Transgenderism is a Dagger Aimed at the Heart of Human Identity
What Does the Bible Say About Transgenderism?
More Like this from The Busy Mom
The Radical Cost of Following Jesus, Part 1 and Part 2
Dare to be a Daniel: Talking to Your Kids About Standing for the Lord – This is startlingly new territory for parents: explaining why a man is being celebrated as a woman on the cover of a magazine is not something we’re used to talking about. Here’s the thing: If we don’t set a place for the truth of Scripture at the table of our children’s hearts, the world will set out a feast all it’s own.
A Spiritual Crisis and a Crossroad: How Should Christians Respond? – Looking around, it’s clear that many Christians have unbuckled the belt of truth under enormous pressure from the culture. Many pastors have begun exchanging the truth of God’s Word for the easy “truth” of the world in an effort to be “loving,” except that denying the truth of God is never loving. I have to wonder if those pastors who will not stand on the authority of Scripture care more about winning a popularity contest than they do about speaking the truth.

item.title: Sacred Responsibility: Why Christian Parents Need to Talk with Their Kids About Transgenderism
item.description:
Did you know that as a Christian, you are an “ambassador” for Christ? God says you are making His appeal through the way you live your life! God’s Word provides guidance for Christians trying to make sense of the transgender moment.When it comes to transgenderism, the Bible actually has a lot to say—not by a prooftext here or there but by a rich and pervasive understanding of gender and sexual identity. (See TGC article)
Obviously, transgenderism, as a cultural trend, is incredibly complex, touching on fields as disparate as genetics, fashion, medicine, law, education, entertainment, athletics, and religious liberty. We need Christians thinking through, and talking to, all of these issues.
Listen in as Heidi tackles this very important topic and reminds us that LOVE, not culture is defines the behavior of God’s people.
More reading: Crossway.com

item.title: Listen, Love, Repeat – Part 2
item.description:
Have you noticed that we tend toward self-centeredness in the culture today? Karen’s noticed, too—and today, we’re talking about how putting others first is one of God’s keys to healthy, whole living.
Karen Ehman is a New York Times bestselling author, Proverbs 31 Ministries speaker, and writer for Encouragement for Today an online devotional that reaches over 4 million women daily. Her latest book Listen, Love, Repeat: Other-Centered Living in a Self-Centered World, is full of ideas for scattering kindness to family, friends, strangers, and the “necessary people” who help you get life done. A wife and mom of three, she resides in central Michigan where she enjoys cheering for the Detroit Tigers and processing life with the many teens that gather around her kitchen island. Connect with her at karenehman.com where she helps women to live their priorities and love their lives.

item.title: Biblical Womanhood – Part 3/3
item.description:
Have you noticed that womanhood, even the heart of femininity is under attack in the culture today?

This week, Heidi is talking honestly about God’s heart for women—and how being created “out” of man brings with it a special calling and a special kind of strength. God created woman to be a helper. “Helper” is a word that demands explanation today…  and so we’re going to talk about it! “Helper” is not a term that indicates a lesser status, or the type of help that assists in an unimportant way. Listen in and be encouraged, busy moms! You are loved, and your role is of unimaginable importance in the eyes of God.

item.title: What’s Your Happiness Style? An Interview with Jennifer Dukes Lee
item.description:
Have you ever wondered what makes your heart sing? The Bible says that God created you with a purpose and He wants to join you in fulfilling it! Today, Heidi talks with the very encouraging Jennifer Dukes Lee as she talks about her “Happiness Style” quiz and helps listeners discover how they can find their sweet spot—the place, relationship, or activity that gives the greatest sense of well-being. Listen in!

 Jennifer Dukes Lee is a storyteller and a grace dweller. She is the author of The Happiness Dare and Love Idol.  Jennifer blogs about faith and life at JenniferDukesLee.com.  You can connect with her on Twitter @dukeslee. Jennifer and her husband, Scott, live on the Lee Family Farm in northwest Iowa, where they spend at least five minutes every day in the pursuit of happiness.
See more at TheHappinessDare.com

Discover your happiness style with the Happiness Style Assessment.

item.title: Sex, Lies and Motherhood
item.description:
A child’s first lessons about their bodies—everything from their appearance to what God says about human sexuality—come from their parents. The messages we give them early in life have a deep, long-lasting impact on how they will see themselves as adults.

So where do we start? How do we pass on a godly perspective of sexuality and beauty to our kids? As in every other area of life, we start at the starting place: the Bible. We dare not trust human wisdom where these tender topics are concerned.

item.title: Dear Church, Jesus Makes You Relevant
item.description:
The modern church is facing a crisis of belief. Do we really believe that the message of the Gospel is enough? Do we really believe that God is big enough to push through the cultural fog and invade the hearts of men and women today? What good is an entertaining church service that fails to entertain the questions that this generation is asking? What good is it if we can’t articulate compassion and truth in a way that clearly addresses the message of the cross? The cross is hope.
…and hope does not disappoint. Hope has a name. It’s Jesus.

The truth of the gospel has not changed. The saving power of a relationship with Jesus is all the relevance we need.

item.title: Learning to Pray the Scriptures
item.description: Do you sometimes wonder how to pray or are you unfamiliar with the Word of God? Writing the Scriptures and learning to personalize them as an example of how to pray is an excellent tool. You're not alone if you struggle to find the words to pray, but we see many people in the Bible who have gone before us and show us examples, so we don't have to stay confused. Join me today as I discuss how I apply these two spiritual disciplines in the life of my family.

item.title: Making Dating Fun Again
item.description: I'm not gonna lie: yesterday was the BEST Valentine's Day I have ever had—and you know what? It was simple. Just me and my man, eating chicken in the back of the mini-van. Yes, we forgot to pack silverware and ended up eating our dinner with the help of Jay's Leatherman knife, but that didn't dampen our fun at all. The point wasn't that it was glamorous, the point was that it was intentional. Join me today as I spend a little more time talking about sex and marriage and why we need to keep having fun together!

item.title: Our God is Mighty to Save!
item.description: It takes a lot of work to train our children, and while we spend a lot of our time and mental energy focusing on it, there is a point where we can forget whose job it really is to save our kids. We can wear ourselves out and forget that God is mighty to save, and it's His job to begin with! So relax, Mom. Do your best in training and remember that our great God created your children for His glory. HE is mighty to save! He's good like that. :)

item.title: Big Picture Parenting Part 4: Arguing
item.description:
I recently got an email from a mom who is having some trouble disciplining her kids.I’m sure we can all agree we have trouble with that from time to time – right?
Parenting is not easy. God wants to shape you, mold you, through the process of parenting your children. Listen to part 4 of 4 as we talk about arguing in our kids, and let's talk through how to replace that with humility and respect!

item.title: The Grinches that Want to Steal Christmas
item.description: There really are are grinches among us, and they want to steal the focused celebration of Christmas. They want us to celebrate a collaboration of all holidays that include everyone (except those who actually want to celebrate CHRISTmas, interestingly enough). But in doing so, they're robbing us of the celebration and identity in celebrating our own holiday! Join Heidi and Durenda today as we talk about these Grinches and how we can fight to celebrate one of the two holidays that really are the foundation of our faith.

item.title: Part 3 of 3: LOVING and Keeping it Real: A Transparent Discussion of Race Between Friends
item.description:
Join me for Part 3 in this series!
Tensions are running high in our nation and in our world right now. Last week on Instagram, I mentioned that I was praying for a peaceful transition of power between Adminstrations, and my new friend, Aaron Young, commented that we needed to do a better job actually talking with each other—black and white—so that we can have a better understanding of where each of us is coming from. I couldn't agree more, and so, I invited two friends of color on the show with me this week.

It's hard at times, but listening to each other is good. I hope you'll be blessed as Aaron, Dr. Lainna Callentine and myself talk openly and honestly about race, the culture, and what we have in common. Be encouraged! We are brothers and sisters in Christ!

item.title: One Nation Under God: America’s New Challenge
item.description:
Three days after the US elections and Americans are asking, "Where do we go from here?" The answer, according to God, is to humbly seek Him in prayer. This is our challenge. To be like Elisha. David. Paul. To pray for healing and revival. Prayer is our most effective and powerful weapon in the battles we are facing as a nation.

If we're going to see our nation prosper again, we must return to God. The Church needs to be on its knees in prayer.

item.title: A Hope That Does Not Disappoint
item.description:
There is a lot of fear in the United States and around the world right now, but did you know that there is an emotion that is more powerful than fear? There is—it's called HOPE.

Hope is a powerful motivator!

As Christians, we dare not put our hope in an election. That doesn't mean we sit it out—it means that we cast our vote with hope.

Hope changes everything. Once we have been obedient, once we have made our stand, when we have done what we could do—when we have prayed, obeyed and trusted—we wait. With hope.

No matter what happens on November 8th, our hope is in Him.

item.title: America’s Moment of Truth
item.description:
America is at fork in the road. If Hillary Clinton is elected, we will be well on our way toward a socialist, globalist nation whose tax payers fund the murder of their own unborn citizens.

Join Heidi St. John as she talks about the very real struggle that the Christian community has had with what to do in the 2016 election. It comes down to justice vs witness—so I ask you—where will our Christian "witness" be if we stand aside and allow the our tax dollars to fund the brutal murder of the unborn? Do we really think God would nod tacitly at His children as they let it happen in the name of Christ?

Our moral indignation at what Trump said eleven years ago will pale in comparison to what Hillary Clinton will do if she is elected to the highest office in the land.

We need to recognize what is really at stake in this election.

"You can choose to look the other way, but you can never again say that you did not know." —William Wilberforce

item.description: It's hard to discipline our kids in a culture that says it's not important, but it is important! item.title: Trusting In God’s Timing
item.description: Our children are involved every day in activities that can affect them for the long term. We can choose to worry about them, try to control it all ourselves or trust the God who made them and loves them more than we can possibly imagine. If you can learn to trust in God's timing for your children, you will trade your worry for the pleasure of a closer walk with Christ and be witness to the sovereignty of God in the lives of your children.

item.title: Yes. I Believe the Whole Thing
item.description:
Last year, a woman on my Facebook page sarcastically asked me, "Do you still believe that old Bible is inerrant?" Well, yes. Yes I do. As Christians, we do not look to worldly reason for the questions a hurting world is asking. We go to the the Bible. Listen in to this archived podcast to a message that never changes.

Recently, a woman on my Facebook page sarcastically asked me, "Do you still believe that old Bible is inerrant?" Well, yes. Yes I do. As Christians, we do not look to worldly reason for the questions a hurting world is asking. We go the the Bible.

As believers and as parents, we need to walk out the truth of God's word by standing firmly on the WHOLE word of God.

item.title: Set Apart – A Call to Live Differently – Part 2
item.description: Have you been tempted to place your hope in a person? You're not alone—but Psalm 62 tells us that our hope should rest in God alone. Our hope as a nation will never be found in a president, in a curriculum, in a pastor or even a parent. Our hope should rest in God and in His Word. This view will not make you popular—but it will bring your peace. Take heart! God has overcome the world!

item.title: “I Want it All” – Meet Gwen Smith!
item.description: "Gwen Smith knows how easy it is to dismiss God’s plans with the thoughts, I can’t make a big difference for God because I’m just an ordinary woman with an ordinary life. Yet God created us to join Him in doing amazing work in the world. He created us to live with abundant joy, courage, and influence. But not the joy, courage, and influence of the world. He offers His grace for each failure, His love that shatters hate, His peace that soothes the turmoil, His comfort, guidance, wisdom, rest, power, and significance. Every blessing He has for us is ours for the taking."

item.title: Courageous Mothering: Encouragement for the Weary Mom
item.description: There are so many things pulling at mothers in this generation—the tug-of-war over our hearts is intentional. Fear, distractions, worry. Satan's goal is to distract moms from what really matters—the bringing up of our children. While the world will tell you to mother your kids from your own strength—God has another way! He wants to replace your weakness with His strength in a beautiful exchange. Your job has never been more important than it is right now. Listen in and be encouraged as Heidi talks about courageous mothering.

item.title: The Lord is My Strength
item.description:
Since surgery, I'm off my game. Can you relate? I have been struggling with staying on an exercise routine these past few weeks. I’ve had a few things in life that knocked me off the exercise wagon and I’ve had a really hard time trying to get back on it. Psalm 18:1 says, “I love You Lord, my strength.”

This is a very long Psalm, but I just want to share a few things that have jumped out to me.

“I call to the Lord who is worthy of praise and I was saved from my enemies. The chords of death have entangled me, the torn of destruction overwhelm me; the chords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death in front of me; in my distress, I call to the Lord. I cry to my God for help.”

If you look down further, it says, “To the faithful, You’ve shown Yourself faithful.” And then in verse 32, “It is God who arms me with strength, and keeps my ways secure. He makes my feet like the feet of a deer. He causes me to stand on the heights; He trains my body for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.”

I don’t know about you, but even when I know that I struggle with the things I want to do, (like exercise) I and I might have to drag myself to do it, but there is this wonderful feeling of accomplishment on the other side of exercise. I just need to force myself to get there.

If you’re feeling that way today, I want to encourage you

item.title: Chores and Children
item.description:
Are you training your kids to help around the house? Several months ago, I put a chore-chart from my friend Toni (The Happy Housewife) on Facebook at The Busy Mom and went about my day. I forgot about it, actually. I thought that moms would love this handy chart, and that people would think, “Yes! Chores for children!”

Boy was I wrong.

I was amazed at how much controversy this little chore-chart generated. Before the end of the day I was called "abusive" and "lazy" for requiring my children to be active participants in our home. And we don't even live on a farm! My children are working inside our house doing the things that people who live in houses do: they are cleaning, cooking, tidying.. and yes, they're playing too.

item.title: A Sit-Down Affair
item.description: We live in a culture that has largely forgotten the power of a shared meal. There is something missing when we rush a busy day to the next. We think we are saving time when we rush through the drive through again, but really we aren’t saving anything. Days turn to weeks, weeks turn to months, and months turn into years. Where we spend our time is a window into our hearts. It is an indicator of where our treasure is. In Matthew 6:21, we read, “For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.”
